name: Alan Ladd Movies Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: Any quiz on Ladd should start with "Shane" - his best movie (and one of the best Westerns ever made). Who played the young boy?
questions.explanation:
Brandon De Wilde.

	A nice job by the kid - who died at 30 in a traffic accident. Great supporting job by Ladd's good friend, Van Heflin. Jean Arthur was also quite good as Heflin's wife; Jack Palance turned in a memorable role as a villain. A classic.

questions.text: Ladd's "breakthrough" came with "This Gun for Hire"; the movie teamed him with a leading lady who would appear in other Ladd movies. Who was she?
questions.explanation:
Veronica Lake.

	Lake was perhaps more known for her hairdo than for anything else; her life was tough and her career was short. Ladd is fine as "Raven", a killer on the loose.

questions.text: "The Blue Dahlia" was another well-known Ladd movie. To what does the movie title refer?
questions.correct: It's the name of a club
options: It's the code name of a covert operation
It's the name of a drink
It's the code name for a killer
questions.explanation:
It's the name of a club.

	This is a good vehicle for Ladd. William Bendix - a good friend of Ladd's - goes along for the ride.

questions.text: "The Iron Mistress" featured Ladd as what famous Westerner?
questions.explanation:
Jim Bowie.

	It's an enjoyable western - but don't pay any attention to the "history". Virginia Mayo plays the girl.

questions.text: Ladd had a role in "Two Years Before the Mast". Who wrote the book on which the movie was based?
questions.explanation:
Richard Henry Dana.

	Brian Donlevy played the author in this tale of men at sea.

questions.text: "The Glass Key" was based on a novel by what author?
questions.explanation:
Dashiell Hammett.

	This was early in Ladd's career. (It was well-received, but I could never get into it.)Brian Donlevy also starred in this one.

questions.text: Ladd starred in the title role of "Whispering Smith". Who co-starred as Smith's friend gone bad?
questions.explanation:
Robert Preston.

	Ladd starred in the title role. Preston turns in his usual fine performance.

questions.text: Who co-starred with Ladd in "Boy on a Dolphin"?
questions.explanation:
Sophia Loren.

	For whatever reason, the movie didn't work. (Script? Chemistry?)

questions.text: Ladd's last role was in this movie.
questions.explanation:
The Carpetbaggers.

	Ladd played Nevada Smith. (Steve McQueen later played the character.)George Peppard starred in this Harold Robbins soaper, which included Carroll Baker and Martha Hyer.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a Ladd movie?
questions.explanation:
Picnic.

	"Frisco" included Edward G. Robinson as the "bad guy". "Jordan" was one of Ladd's first starring roles. "Botany" was an enjoyable  adventure tale. "Picnic" starred William Holden.
